results.title: Witness to Auschwitz
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Robin Taylor
results.brief_description: This program describes the events behind the gates of Auschwitz using archival footage and photographs. This program documents the experiences of Rudolph Verba, one of the few to escape Auschwitz and co-author the report which unveiled the horror of the Nazi work camps.
results.description: This program describes the events behind the gates of Auschwitz using archival footage and photographs. This program documents the experiences of Rudolph Verba, one of the few to escape Auschwitz and co-author the report which unveiled the horror of the Nazi work camps.

results.title: Without prejudice
results.brief_description: The facts about epilepsy are contrasted with popular misconceptions. The theme is the need for unbiased attitudes towards people with epilepsy. Children who have epilepsy are shown talking about their problems. The effect that public ignorance has on people with epilepsy is clearly illustrated.

results.title: Without love = Bez milosci [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Zespoly Filmowe, Iluzjon Film Unit and Barbara Sass
results.brief_description: Pill-popping reporter Ewa Bracka (Dorota Stalinska), needs her uppers to fuel her all-consuming non-stop attempts at getting “the story”. Her determination to be a top journalist has no boundaries - cynical, ruthless, unethical, and unscrupulous, Ewa is prepared to sleep her way to the top. As Ewa herself says “The object of life is to live. To have it all and at any price”. Ewa is a single parent, living in Warsaw with her young daughter (the result of an affair whilst in Rome). With the help and support of her mother in caring for her daughter, Ewa is able to pursue her career, take up judo lessons and maintain the odd affair or two. Ewa believes in the issue, but has no time for the people, innocent or guilty, whom she may expose in getting her story on to the front page. That is until she meets and befriends Marianna, a young girl who lives and works in a local brothel. Through Marianna, Ewa is finally forced to confront her own demons. Cast includes Wladyslaw Kowalski, Malgorzata Zajaczkowska, Zdzislaw Wardejn, Emilian Kaminski, Jadwiga Polanowska, Malgorzata Pritulak. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Without consent
results.brief_description: Attempts to gain an understanding of sexually related violence in Australia. “Every woman’s fear. Part 1”: Examines the impact of a rape which occurred in Broadford Victoria in March 1991. The effects of sexual assault on victims, their families and the community are shown through poignant interviews with victims, police and counsellors. “The Dark Side. Part 2”: Provides an insight into the mind of the rapist with offenders describing their motivations, emotions and their view of the victim. Contains a powerful interview with a victim of male sexual assault.

results.title: Within these city walls
results.brief_description: Today in the old German cities we can still meet the Middle Ages. Through their buildings, pictures and documents we can trace the history of their growth, the expansion of trade and development of craftsmanship. The proud and beautiful buildings of medieval cities and towns are a memento of their struggle for liberty and municipal independence.

results.title: Withdrawal behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: P. Hefferman-Cabera, Gesa de Rozner and Science Research Association
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”.
Withdrawal is a response to overwhelming threat to identity. This film looks at behaviour in the classroom which can produce a withdrawal in both students and teachers, and indicates how to recognise this behaviour when it is occurring.

results.title: With these hands
results.creator_credit: Promotional Films, International Ladies Garment Workers' Union and Jack Arnold
results.brief_description: The story of the International Ladies Garment Workers’ Union. Signing his retirement blank, Alexander Brody looks back over the years to 1910 when the ILGWU was founded; he remembers the days of the pickets, the Great Revolt, the harrowing holocaust of the Triangle fire, the days of trouble in the 1920s and finally the emergence of union power. The film also illustrates the present work of the union. With Sam Levene, Arlene Francis and Joseph Wiseman.

results.title: With the best of intentions
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Robin Hughes and Bill Steller
results.brief_description: This film looks at the lives of children growing up in different environments. Compares two professional Sydney families to show how broader social developments and conflicts are reflected in middle-class approaches to child rearing.

results.title: With music ring
results.brief_description: Featuring the Mormon Tabernacle Choir of 375 voices. Shows how the building of a great composite sound such as the Mormon Tabernacle Choir requires hard work and a man of talent on the podium.
